channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Come Enjoy Coffee and Art on September 10!
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - To be held in the Mueller Center lobby , this creative and social event gives students a chance enjoy a variety of coffee options while participating in different arts and crafts activities in a relaxed atmosphere. Stop by to unwind, connect with peers, and engage in creative hands-on projects!
item.author: Students

item.title: SWE, Women in Business Holding Info Session with Deloitte
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 5:30 AM - 6:30 AM - Join the Society of Women Engineers and Women in Business in talking with Deloitte, a company looking to hire seniors and juniors for both full-time and internship Consulting and Risk & Financial Advisory roles.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Working in the U.S.: CPT & Internships” Virtual Workshop to be Held for Graduate Students
item.description: Date: Thursday, September 12, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Join the Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) and International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for a virtual workshop to learn about the internship search and the ways to get Curricular Practical Training (CPT) to work in the U.S. before graduation! This session has information specific to graduate students.
item.author: Students

item.title: Covid-19 Guidance for Fall 2024
item.description: Covid-19 continues to affect our community, requiring us to adapt and change our protocols in response to evolving knowledge about the virus and changes in population immunity and susceptibility. Please read for details on what to do if you get sick, as well as prevention, testing, treatment, and other on-campus protocols.
item.author: Students

item.title: Bicentennial Campus Carnival - Friday, September 13, 2024 11:00 AM - 7:00 PM
item.description: In celebration of our Bicentennial, we invite the campus community to join us for a carnival with a Ferris wheel, food trucks, lawn games, and more. Friday, September 13, 2024 11:00 AM - 7:00 PM
item.author: Community

item.title: Multimedia Services: Slido Polling Tool Now Available
item.description: Multimedia Services would like to inform the Rensselaer community that the Slido polling tool is now available and integrated with the campus’ Webex license.
item.author: Community

item.title: MIT’s Anette “Peko” Hosoi to Speak at DiPrima Lecture
item.description: Date: Monday, September 9, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - In honor of Professor Richard C. DiPrima, professor of Mathematics and former Department Chair, the lecture will feature Anette ‘Peko’ Hosoi from MIT, titled “A Few Short Stories About Mathematics and Sports.”
item.author: Community

item.title: CMDIS to Host Facilities Open House September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM - Center for Materials, Devices and Integrated Systems (CMDIS) invites you to their Facilities Open House, which will be followed by a BBQ! Please sign up by September 9 for facility tours to learn about tools, instrumentation capabilities, fabrication and characterization techniques, and much more.
item.author: Community

item.title: MBA for Professionals Review to be Held September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.
item.author: Community

item.title: ISATMA 2024, “Voice as Identity,” to be Held September 13-14
item.description: Date: Friday, September 13, 2024 - Sat , September 14, 2024 (all day) - EMPAC Research invites artists and scholars across all abilities to the International Symposium on Assistive Technology for Music and Art (ISATMA), featuring two days of live and hybrid performances and workshops with adaptive technologies, as well as presentations and panels in an inclusive environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: iEar Presents Guest Speaker Oron Catts
item.description: This talk with Oron Catts will explore and unpack artistic projects that deals with the ways current applications of biological knowledge confuse our cultural understanding and relationships with the concepts of life, nature and land. Join us at 5pm-6:30pm on September 10 in the CBIS Auditorium.
item.author: Community

item.title: Fidelity Schedules Confidential In-Person Retirement Consultation Sessions
item.description:
Date: Monday, September 16, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - Schedule a confidential consultation to help you become better informed and more confident about your workplace retirement savings plan benefits!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
